body:
Main answer: The database migration on upgrade just requires too much memory for your system. There might be workarounds, but that's better suited for https://forum.syncthing.net

"Internal" Implementation stuff: Looking at the migration, we do not `Checkpoint` the transaction, meaning it will only be committed when reaching 128MiB instead of the 1MiB in usual operations. That looks like an oversight, I doubt the fewer commits will speed the whole thing up by much, or does it? ( @calmh )
I doubt that as well, we should checkpoint here and there in the transition. Good 1.4.1 material.
Thank you both. I will try the forums. By the way, I really appreciate syncthing. Kudos on the great work!

rename.from: "fatal error: runtime: out of memory" after upgrade syncthing from version 1.3.2 to 1.4.0 on a QNAP NAS TS-419 II
rename.to: "fatal error: runtime: out of memory" during database migration on QNAP NAS

body:
The fix in version 1.4.1-rc worked! Thanks!

**[/share/MD0_DATA/.qpkg/syncthing] # tail sync.log**
[start] 11:04:22 INFO: syncthing v1.4.1-rc.1 "Fermium Flea" (go1.13.8 linux-arm) teamcity@build.syncthing.net 2020-03-18 19:33:43 UTC
[start] 11:04:22 INFO: Automatic upgrade is always enabled for candidate releases.
[CKUR5] 11:04:23 INFO: My ID: XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX ## edited ##
[CKUR5] 11:04:25 INFO: Single thread SHA256 performance is 8.3 MB/s using crypto/sha256 (7.8 MB/s using minio/sha256-simd).
[CKUR5] 11:04:27 INFO: Hashing performance is 13.73 MB/s
[CKUR5] 11:04:27 INFO: Migrating database to schema version 9...
[CKUR5] 11:06:14 INFO: Compacting database after migration...
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: Detected upgrade from v1.3.2 to v1.4.1-rc.1
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: Starting deadlock detector with 20m0s timeout
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: Overall send rate is unlimited, receive rate is unlimited
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: Anonymous usage reporting is always enabled for candidate releases.
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: Relay listener (dynamic+https://relays.syncthing.net/endpoint) starting
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: QUIC listener (0.0.0.0:22000) starting
[CKUR5] 11:08:57 INFO: TCP listener (0.0.0.0:22000) starting

Just to confirm, my mipsle device (512MB ram) using 1.4.1-rc-3 was able to start now :-)
Migration took around 8 minutes, half of the time on compacting, db size before: 665MB, afterwards: 190MB  

Thank you guys. Also really helpfull was that on RC releases you provide builds for every platform (https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/releases/). Kudos from mipsle arch users!

issue.title: Problem with migrating database

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I just updated synthing from version 1.3.4 to 1.4.0 on a raspberry pi 2, running with another rapsberry pi 4 (not updated yet), three windows 10 PCs (1.4.0 and 1.4.1). Everything was working smoothly before the update, but after that, it crashed on the raspberry pi 2 with a "out of memory" error message" (see below). The GUI do not show anymore, and checking with STTRACE=scanner didn't gave any relevant clue. 

Here is the stderr

> [start] 21:54:52 INFO: syncthing v1.4.0 "Fermium Flea" (go1.13.8 linux-arm) deb@build.syncthing.net 2020-03-06 19:52:22 UTC
> [KSDQO] 21:54:52 INFO: My ID: _blablabla_
> [KSDQO] 21:54:53 INFO: Single thread SHA256 performance is 9.2 MB/s using crypto/sha256 (9.2 MB/s using minio/sha256-simd).
> [KSDQO] 21:54:53 VERBOSE: Starting up (/home/pi/.config/syncthing)
> [KSDQO] 21:54:54 INFO: Hashing performance is 8.46 MB/s
> [KSDQO] 21:54:54 INFO:Migrating  database to schema version 9...
> fatal error: runtime: out of memory

here is the log file
